intro: Galium trojanum, commonly known as Trojan bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters, which are typically arranged in umbels. Its leaves are usually oval or lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium trojanum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
